intro: Tetraphyle alpestris, commonly known as the alpine tetraphyle, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Tetraphyle alpestris plays a vital role in alpine ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various insect and animal species.
